metadata.title: CVE-2024-31080 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The ProcXIGetSelectedEvents() function uses the byte-swapped length of thereturn data for the amount of data to return to the client, if the clienthas a different endianness than the X server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-31080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
xserver-common - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
xvfb - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.9').
xwayland package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.12').
